title: Senior Software Engineer ‎
description:
**Software development that makes a difference**
 At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Volvo Cars Car Configurator team is seeking a
 **Senior Fullstack Engineer** 
 with a passion for developing efficient, scalable, and user-friendly interfaces. The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of
 **React** 
 ,
 **NextJS** 
 , and
 **server-side rendering** 
 . Our application serves millions of customers monthly across 80+ countries around the world. When a customer needs to customise a new car on volvocars.com, that’s where we come in. Help us bring the best possible shopping experience to Volvo customers!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web applications using React and NextJS.
* Implement server-side rendering to improve the performance and user experience of our web applications.
* Write comprehensive unit tests and end-to-end tests to ensure the robustness and reliability of the frontend applications.
* Collaborate with the backend team to integrate APIs and services.
* Participate in code reviews to maintain a high-quality codebase.


**Leadership Responsibilities**
* Take ownership of projects from conception to production deployment.
* Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and clients to ensure requirements are met and to discuss any potential challenges.
* Collaborate with various stakeholders, including product managers, designers, and backend engineers, to ensure that the frontend applications align with the company’s goals.
* Provide and refactor a code base that enables the other engineers on the team.
* Lead technical initiatives or coach and mentor other engineers to own features from start to finish themselves.
* Balance tech-debt vs delivering value.


**You And Your Skills**
* Proven experience as a Frontend Engineer or Fullstack JavaScript/TypeScript Engineer.
* Proficiency in React, NextJS, TypeScript and server-side rendering.
* Experience with frontend testing frameworks and strategies, such as Playwright and Storybook.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to take ownership of projects.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, including documentation and sharing knowledge with colleagues.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Familiarity with backend JavaScript frameworks and runtimes, such as Node.js and Bun.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure in AWS/Azure or similar.
* Container orchestration engines, e.g. Kubernetes.
* GraphQL.
* Content Distribution Networks, e.g. Akamai.
* A passion for vehicles and the car industry!
* Leading technical initiatives in a collaborative fashion.


 Location: Stockholm, Hybrid
   

  

 Want to know more? We hope so
   

  

 We welcome you to apply in english before 19th October the latest. We will go through applications on a regular basis. Please apply through the provided link. Applications submitted via email will not be retained or taken into consideration. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.
   

  

 Who are we?
   

  

 Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

title: Software Engineer - Platform
description:
*Är du en service-minded och erfaren Javautvecklare som brinner för att skapa innovativa och robusta plattformslösningar åt våra 30 + utvecklingsteam? Vi söker nu en kollega som vill bidra till Avanzas applikationsplattform!* 




  





**Om Teamet** 




 Team Applikationsplattform, som idag består av två utvecklare och en produktägare, har som mission att göra det enkelt för alla våra Java-utvecklare på Avanza att självständigt utveckla affärsfunktionalitet baserat på en standardiserad applikationsstruktur. Vi gör det genom interna verktyg och ramverk som hanterar persistens, icke-funktionella krav och möjliggör smidiga uppgraderingar av plattformen.
 



  





 I vårt team arbetar vi med att skapa en modern plattform där produktteam kan innovera fritt och lita på att plattformen stöttar dem hela vägen till produktion. Målet är att plattformen är cutting-edge men stabil, och vi fokuserar på att uppgraderingar når produktion smidigt, tryggt och automatiserat. Vi strävar mot zero-downtime deployment, så att våra team kan släppa nya funktioner när som helst, med full trygghet.
 



  





 Som medlem i teamet kommer du att ha stor möjlighet att påverka teknikval framåt, få en stor förståelse för hur alla system på Avanza hänger ihop och ha daglig kontakt med övriga utvecklingsteam i en miljö med högt i tak och korta beslutsvägar.
 



  





**Din Profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är en självgående och lösningsorienterad utvecklare med en passion för att skapa robusta och skalbara system. Du trivs i en miljö där du får ta initiativ och där tekniska diskussioner med kollegor är en del av vardagen. Att skriva läsbar och underhållbar kod är något du brinner för, och du strävar alltid efter att leverera mjukvara med hög kvalitet. Du har en förmåga att se mönster i komplexa system och du gillar att tänka nytt och utmana befintliga lösningar för att driva utvecklingen framåt. Med din kunskap och ditt engagemang är du en mentor och en teknisk vägvisare för dina kollegor.
 



  





 Vidare har teamet många beröringspunkter med övriga utvecklingsteam vilket ställer krav på bra kommunikationsförmåga samt att du har ett vänligt och hjälpsamt bemötande mot andra.
 



  





**Vi tror också att du har:** 



* Goda kunskaper inom Java, Spring och Maven
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i en storskalig organisation
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande är det också om du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Plattformsutveckling i en mikrotjänstarktitektur
* Molnplattformar (ex. GCP)
* GigaSpaces
* MongoDB



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den
 **6** 
**Oktober** 
 . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Backend Developer - Distributed Services
description:
**Job Description**
 We're expanding our NetEnt Core Platform team in Stockholm and are on the hunt for passionate Software Engineers. You are either already proficient in Scala and functional programming or enthusiastic about learning. In this role, you'll be responsible for backend applications that manage the logic of our 300+ first person casino games, all developed and operated by us at Evolution Group.
   

  

 Our team is committed to developing, maintaining, and enhancing multiple backend applications and libraries that together deliver a high-performance, low-latency gaming experience for our players. We take pride in our well-designed, scalable systems that utilize modern functional programming-based design approaches. We firmly believe that Scala's functional programming approach results in high-performing systems that are simpler to construct and maintain. If you're a passionate Software Engineer looking to make a significant impact in the gaming industry, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

**You will need to:**
* Be proactive, pragmatic and professional, deliver results
* Write code that make our games and related functionality run
* Write unit and other automated tests
* Work and communicate efficiently with the rest of the development team, including PO, front-end developers and design
* Actively participate in code reviews so that code delivered by you and your team is of great quality
* Own your applications, ensure they deploy and run 24/7 on our Kubernetes platform with great performance
* Be ready to invest the effort to become an even better developer


**Qualifications**
* Have proven experience in delivering production software using Scala, Java or comparable language
* Be familiar with functional/reactive, asynchronous, non-blocking styles of programming
* Passion for our profession and improving yourself technically
* Have a problem solving mindset, including that you are willing to move outside your comfort zone and learn and work with new technologies.
* Excellent communication skills
* Highly proficient in spoken and written English
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent


**We will appreciate experience with or wiliness to learn about:**
* Building high performance clustered systems, modular FP-based architecture, as well as actor systems, where they are necessary
* Cats, Cats Effect, ZIO, Monix, Akka Actors, Akka Persistence, Akka Cluster, http4s, Tagless Final
* Event Sourcing & CQRS
* Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, Cassandra


**Additional Information**
 Exiting opportunity at our brand new office in the heart of Stockholm with amazing colleagues! Join our dynamic international team and be a part of a vibrate work environment where innovation thrives. Embrace the city´s energy as you contribute to our company´s growth!
   

  

 Evolution provides a dynamic and creative work environment with a unique opportunity for the right people to enhance their skills and drive their passion. Our culture is rooted in Evolution’s core values ALIVE, do RIGHT and work TOGETHER and we operate guided by our vision to become the leading supplier of online casino in the world. Apply now and be a key player in our success story!
   

  

**Our Benefits Are**
* Competitive pension and health insurance
* 30 paid vacation days
* Fitness benefit (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* Professional growth
* Sport activities, parties, team buildings

title: Application Manager
description:
Are you an experienced Java developer or application specialist ready to take the next step in your career? Crosskey is looking for an Application Manager to join our Credits Core Banking team, a group of skilled experts with a strong team spirit. This role offers a fantastic opportunity for professional growth through the use of modern technologies and the chance to contribute your own ideas to drive development within the company. If this sounds intriguing, read on and apply today!
 







  





**Company Overview:** 




 We are at an exciting juncture, expanding our credit origination operations in Finland and launching new products for the Finnish market. We are creating innovative solutions with no legacy systems, focusing on a new team structure and agile methodologies. Join us in a friendly and supportive work environment across our four locations, with central offices and ergonomic work equipment. Enjoy a hybrid working situation, with a minimum of two days per week in the office.
 







  





**Position Summary:** 




 As a Senior Java Application Manager/Developer, you will play a critical role in shaping, upgrading, and maintaining our applications. You will ensure the seamless functioning of these applications, support project operations, and guide technical improvements. This position requires strong analytical skills, advanced Java programming expertise, and the ability to mentor junior developers. We are looking for someone who is solution-oriented, has a positive outlook, strong communication skills (both internally and with customers), is open-minded, and ready to help wherever needed. You should be a team player with the ability to delegate and follow up on tasks.
 







  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Analyse, Specify, and Document New Functionality: Assess customer needs and technical aspects, develop detailed technical requirements, and document them accordingly.
* Technical Leadership and Mentorship: Conduct code reviews, provide technical guidance, and mentor junior developers to maintain high code quality and promote best practices.
* System Maintenance: Perform regular maintenance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure the reliability and performance of applications.
* Documentation and Requirements Tracking: Regularly update system documentation and track system requirements.
* Stakeholder Consultation: Collaborate with clients, engineers, security specialists, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical guidance.
* Continuous Improvement: Implement small daily changes to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and proactively resolve issues.







  





**Required Competencies and Experience:** 



* System Design and Impact Assessment, with strong analytical abilities in system design and a deep understanding of software engineering principles.
* Expertise in Java programming with full-stack experience (Java, Spring Boot, Angular).
* Ability to coach and mentor other team members, enhancing their skills and performance.
* University degree in Software Development or a related field, or equivalent.
* 5-8 years’ experience in Java development, particularly in banking technology. Extensive experience in software design, development, and system administration.
* Fluency in English. Swedish and Finnish are advantageous.







  





**Preferred Technical Experience:** 



* Familiarity with Spring Boot, Gradle, Oracle/SQL, JUnit, automated testing, Jenkins/continuous integration, security protocols, web services (SOAP/REST), AWS cloud, Linux/Bash, Splunk/EKS stack, and OP5/cloud/elastic cloud.
* Competence in RESTful API design and with JBoss and AWS Fargate.
* Knowledge of banking systems, specifically credit and loan systems, is advantageous but not required.
* Experience in agile workflows and methodologies.







  





**Why Join Us?** 




 Work in a friendly and supportive environment during an exciting time of development, contributing to the launch of a new banking product for the Finnish market. Enjoy flexible work locations and hybrid working options, and actively engage in team, department, and company-level events. Perks including a lunch benefit, training/cultural benefit, and you will receive six weeks of vacation.
 







  





**To Apply:** 




 If this sounds interesting, please apply with your CV and a short introduction about yourself. Please note that a security clearance will be conducted for the selected candidate. For further information, please contact our recruiter Emma at emma.hjorth@barona.se. Apply today as the position may be filled before the application deadline.
 







  





**About Crosskey:** 




 Founded in 2004, Crosskey combines extensive IT knowledge with flexibility, commitment, and a personal touch. We make it easier to create new income from financial services, enabling you to get to market faster with the right offer. Our expertise covers everything from traditional banking to eBanking, card and mobile payments, capital markets, and Open Banking. We have offices in Mariehamn, Stockholm, Helsinki, and Turku. Our customers span the Nordic region and include the Bank of Åland, S-Pankki, DNB, and Marginalen Bank. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Business Developer in Group Architecture Management Office
description:
**Job ID: 25860** 


  
 





 We are now offering an opportunity to join the newly established Management Office in Group Architecture. A unique chance to join the team already from start where you will have a chance to build something from scratch and influence direction forward.
 





  

  



 Group Architecture (GA) is a unit within Group Business Support (GBS) and recently separated from Group Technology to stand on its own legs ;). We are now looking for a Business Developer to join Group Architecture Management Office and to work closely with executive management both in GBS, Group Architecture and across the bank to ensure timely and efficient deliveries on our prioritized change initiatives.
 





  

  



 This role will give you a front row seat to gain knowledge and insight on many of the essential processes and decisions enabling us to serve our customers and to keep our bank safe and trusted. You will have a steep and continuous learning curve being a part of the environment between Business and Technology. 
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 


  
 





 Welcome to the newly established Management Office team in GA. We are a Nordic team that is responsible for ensuring that all areas within GA have structure, progress and processes in place. The unit is expanding both in colleagues and responsibilities. Our ambition is to support the management team with various deliveries, both with a short-deadline and more long-term perspective.
 







  
 







 As the Business Developer, you will play a valuable role in ensuring the quality and oversight GA change agenda, plan for and ensure progress together with the management team and stakeholders.
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Support the creation of high quality execution plans for operational and strategic deliveries
* Work collaboratively with senior stakeholders across GBS, GA and the Business Areas to identify solutions to issues and assist in the successful delivery of the targets/plans
* Proactively highlight areas of improvements regarding GA Operating Model, Ways of Working, Performance Management etc and suggest feasible solutions
* Take ownership for parts of GA Governance model by ensuring structure, follow-up and timely delivery to governing forums, oversight committees and stakeholders



  
 





 Our environment is demanding and volatile, demands develop fast and often involve many stakeholders. This requires agility and a certain level of flexibility. As a new team, we are striving to create an environment where personal wellbeing and work life balance is respected while ensuring top quality deliveries.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Understand and can drive initiatives from idea to implementation
* Thrive on working with stakeholders to create quality output in a collaborative and solution orientated way
* Use feedback, experience and acquired knowledge to improve areas of responsibility
* Have a strong inclination to structure and plan work to enable proactivity and ensuring timely deliveries
* Have strong communication and networking skills combined with a personal drive
* Contribute with a positive and “can-do” attitude, share knowledge, and seek feedback



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Project management skills, including experience in planning, monitoring, and reviewing
* Experience to run governance processes including reporting – advantage but not a requirement
* Presentation and communication skills fit for senior stakeholders
* Experience in working with stakeholders across countries and units
* Fluency in written and spoken English



  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 16/09/2024
 



 . Please note that we will start interviewing during the application period. For more information about the position, please contact Erna Botonic e-mail erna.botonic@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden -** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

title: Integrationsarkitekt/utvecklare
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till MuleSoft, WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

 Som integrationsutvecklare är din huvudsakliga uppgift att utveckla plattformar som möjliggör integrationen av olika system att jobba sömlöst tillsammans.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Utveckla API:er och integrationer med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Camel, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Ha tät dialog med kund, teamet och användare för att designa och implementera de bästa tekniska lösningarna
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i Mulesoft Anypoint Platform, WSO2 eller annan ledande integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: System Architect
description:
**We are looking for a System Architect to the Architect team in Core & Credits at Crosskey** 




  





 As an Architect at Core & Credits, you will be a key player in shaping the future of our products. You’ll contribute significantly to the agile development of Team Customer and collaborate closely with your Architect colleagues in a dynamic virtual team environment. Your dual role as a developer and acting architect will be instrumental in driving the technical evolution of our solutions.
 



  





 We value a strong grasp of both business and technology. You should be technically skilled, forward-thinking, and an exceptional communicator. Proficiency in English is essential, and knowledge of Swedish or other languages is an added advantage.
 



  





**You should apply if:** 



* You are passionate about crafting scalable, secure software systems that align with business needs while adhering to industry standards and best practices.
* You possess a solid understanding of principles and practices involved in designing and developing system architecture for both cloud services (AWS) and on-premises solutions.
* You have successfully migrated legacy software to cloud services, ensuring a seamless transition.
* You are adept at making decisions that align with business goals and technical requirements, and you recognize the importance of keeping necessary stakeholders informed.
* You excel at identifying issues, analyzing solutions, and implementing the best course of action.
* Collaboration is one of your strengths; you thrive in working with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, provide technical guidance, and ensure the successful execution of solutions.
* You are dedicated to conducting security assessments and implementing best practices to safeguard software systems against potential threats.
* You have several years of software development experience, with expertise in key technologies such as Java, AWS, RPG, Spring and Microservices.



  





  





**Why Join Us?** 




 Work in a friendly and supportive environment during an exciting time of development, contributing to the launch of a new banking product for the Finnish market. Enjoy flexible work locations and hybrid working options, and actively engage in team, department, and company-level events. Perks including a lunch benefit, training/cultural benefit, and you will receive six weeks of vacation.
 



  





  





**To Apply:** 




 If this sounds interesting, please apply with your CV and a short introduction about yourself. Please note that a security clearance will be conducted for the selected candidate. For further information, please contact our recruiter Emma at emma.hjorth@barona.se. Apply today as the position may be filled before the application deadline.
 



  





  





**About Crosskey:** 




 Founded in 2004, Crosskey combines extensive IT knowledge with flexibility, commitment, and a personal touch. We make it easier to create new income from financial services, enabling you to get to market faster with the right offer. Our expertise covers everything from traditional banking to eBanking, card and mobile payments, capital markets, and Open Banking. We have offices in Mariehamn, Stockholm, Helsinki, and Turku. Our customers span the Nordic region and include the Bank of Åland, S-Pankki, DNB, and Marginalen Bank. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Engineering Manager - Platform Engineering
description:
**About The Team**
 Join our Platform Engineering team, a cornerstone in delivering and maintaining cutting-edge tools and services that empower our development teams across Schibsted Media. We collaborate closely with teams from prominent publications such as VG, Aftenposten, Aftonbladet, SvD, and Omni to ensure the developer tooling we provide meets their needs and exceeds their expectations.
   

  

 Our infrastructure leverages AWS services, with Docker for containerization and EKS/Convox for orchestration, creating a robust and scalable environment.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As an Engineering Manager in Platform Engineering, you will lead a dynamic team responsible for critical domains, including:
   

  

* Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools
* Containers and Runtime environments utilizing Docker, Kubernetes (EKS), and Convox (ECS)
* Monitoring tools for metrics, logs, and alerts
* Provisioning capabilities and cloud accounts for AWS and other cloud platforms
* FinOps to optimize and monitor costs effectively


 You will engage directly with development teams across Schibsted Media to understand their needs and deliver relevant and innovative tooling solutions. In this role, you will also set the strategic direction for our infrastructure, ensuring it aligns with Schibsted Media’s goals.
   

  

 During the Schibsted Media demerger, you will play a key role in supporting and completing the transition of services to the new Schibsted Media setup, while managing your team to deliver exceptional services throughout this period.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To excel in this role, you should bring:
   

  

* Proven Leadership: Experience in leading and building software development or infrastructure teams with strong motivational skills.
* Technical Expertise:
+ Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, containerization, and automation from both product and engineering perspectives.
+ Strong understanding of AWS services, CI/CD practices, and container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
+ Familiarity with Linux/Unix systems, networking, databases, and storage solutions.
+ Experience with cloud pricing models, billing mechanisms, and cost optimization strategies.

* Collaboration & Communication: A collaborative, pragmatic approach with excellent communication skills, enabling you to work effectively across the organization.
* Service-Oriented Mindset: A focus on delivering high-quality solutions that meet the needs of our diverse development teams.


 This role offers an exciting opportunity to lead a team that is pivotal in shaping the infrastructure that supports Schibsted Media’s diverse range of products and services.

title: Senior C# developer to Pricing & Billing team | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you looking for stimulating work, responsibility and a solid team of subject matter experts? Look no further!
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About the role:**
 We work with centralized billing. Our solution calculates 600 different charges and distributes millions of invoices to hundreds of thousands of SEB customers. Our core is a bought billing system, integrated with 30 plus SEB systems via a steadily growing set of in-house developed applications. You will spend a lot of time developing and maintaining our applications – and keep them running. If you are willing and able, you might develop into our lead developer. Our core tech stack is C#, PostgreSQL, OpenShift, GitHub actions.
   

  

 Our team and our product owners sit together and work from the office more often than not. We will enter a project to replace the bought system and this will give opportunities to develop and re-architecture. You will notice that it is relatively easy to get from idea to decision as the team is close to management and product owners, both physically and relation wise. The team is self-organized and has freedom and flexibility.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Curiosity and willingness to learn new things
* Proven skills and experience in C# development, and some Angular as well
* Working experience of agile development practices and CI/CD
* Good communication skills and fluency in English


 If you also happen to like Clojure or know a little bit of basic accounting, it could be a match made in heaven.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than2024-09-20. If you have questions about the position, please contact Anders Subotic via e-mail: anders.subotic @seb.se.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: CTO Co-Founder for Blockchain Project
description:
If you are passionate about privacy, transparency, whisteblowing and the power of decentralized technology to drive social impact, this might be for you!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the end-to-end technical development of the projects decentralized social media platform.
* Architect a secure, resilient, and scalable P2P infrastructure leveraging blockchain technology for identity verification, data distribution, and content integrity.
* Implement robust privacy and encryption mechanisms, ensuring user anonymity and data protection.
* Oversee smart contract development and blockchain integration, ensuring seamless content moderation, governance (via DAO), and incentive structures.
* Collaborate closely with co-founders on defining the product roadmap, ensuring alignment between technical feasibility and business goals.
* Drive decisions on technology stack, development tools, and ensure best practices for coding, testing, and deployment.
* Build and lead a talented technical team, fostering a culture of innovation, security, and collaboration.



  





**What You’ll Need:** 



* Proven experience as a CTO, lead developer, or in a similar leadership role, preferably in a blockchain, decentralized, or P2P-based project.
* Deep knowledge of blockchain platforms (e.g., Ethereum, Cardano, Polkadot), decentralized storage solutions (IPFS), and cryptographic protocols.
* Strong understanding of Zero-Knowledge Proofs, end-to-end encryption, and secure communications.
* Experience with smart contract development (Solidity, Rust) and deploying decentralized applications (dApps).
* Familiarity with privacy-focused technologies like Tor, I2P, and governance frameworks such as DAOs.
* Passion for privacy, security, freedom of expression, and ethical whistleblowing.
* Strong leadership skills, with the ability to mentor and build a high-performing technical team.
* Ability to think strategically, balancing short-term development goals with the long-term vision of the platform.



  





**Bonus Points For:** 



* Prior experience working on whistleblower protection platforms, secure communication tools, or activism-related technologies.
* Experience with token economies, staking mechanisms, or building incentive models for decentralized networks.
* A strong network in the blockchain or privacy tech communities.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Equity in a mission-driven company focused on driving transparency and social impact.
* The opportunity to build a platform that can empower whistleblowers and change the way sensitive information is shared globally.
* Flexibility and autonomy to shape the platform’s technical vision and roadmap from the ground up.
* A dynamic, remote-friendly work environment with passionate co-founders.



  





 If you’re excited about the potential of blockchain technology to safeguard truth and protect whistleblowers, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**How to Apply:** 
 Send your resume, LinkedIn profile.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Build and Release Engineer, Back end, DevOps, Automation)
description:
The era of pervasive AI has arrived. In this era, organizations will use generative AI to unlock hidden value in their data, accelerate processes, reduce costs, drive efficiency and innovation to fundamentally transform their businesses and operations at scale.
   

  

 SambaNova Suite™ is the first full-stack, generative AI platform, from chip to model, optimized for enterprise and government organizations. Powered by the intelligent SN40L chip, the SambaNova Suite is a fully integrated platform, delivered on-premises or in the cloud, combined with state-of-the-art open-source models that can be easily and securely fine-tuned using customer data for greater accuracy. Once adapted with customer data, customers retain model ownership in perpetuity, so they can turn generative AI into one of their most valuable assets.
   

  

 Working at SambaNova
   

  

 This role offers a unique chance to influence the future of AI and the transformative impact it can have across all facets of an organization’s business and operations. It is a high-profile position that will drive the evolution of our AI platform, delivering top-tier cost-efficient software solutions, you will be part of a team building and updating packages and systems, helping to deliver the software artifacts to our customers, continuous delivery flows. You will also help support the software teams build systems and utilise distributed build systems. Also helping to drive the advancement of our developer experience as we expand into a global SaaS leader.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build cutting-edge tools and flows at scale across hybrid cloud environments to enhance software development, testing, and deployment efficiency
* Closely working pipelines to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies and develop solutions to improve overall time and resource utilization
* Help drive the adoption of cutting-edge public cloud technologies across hybrid cloud environments to accelerate overall developer velocity
* Be part of developing robust and scalable systems for building and managing the deployment of software artifacts
* Oversee the maintenance of leading continuous integration systems and ensure seamless integration with other systems and tools for optimal performance
* Design and implement streamlined industry-standard practices and policies for DevOps, GitOps and MLOps across various teams and functions.
* Work closely with stakeholders to assess and implement enterprise-level systems that align with the organization's goals and objectives


**Would would like you to be qualified as follows: -**
* 7+ years in software engineering, technology architecture, and DevOps with a demonstrated ability to design, implement, and maintain secure, scalable, and resilient systems to support software development and deployment
* BS in CS, CE, EE or relevant field


**Whilst also having: -**
* Strong understanding of Linux Administration and operating system concepts and proficiency with Bash scripting/ Shell Scripting
* Containers (docker, podman), (K8s is a plus)
* RPM and DEB packaging
* Extensive experience building enterprise-grade software with Python, Go, or other modern programming languages
* Solid understanding of fundamental CI/CD, GitOps, and DevOps concepts and experience with building pipelines using technologies such as Jenkins or CircleCI (Artifactory is a plus, SonarQube is alsoa plus)
* An understanding of provisioning infrastructure in a hybrid-cloud environment, infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles, and familiarity with relevant technologies such as Ansible and Terraform
* Familiarity with container image building and container runtimes
* Experience with building Linux packages and distribution platforms like Artifactory or similar technologies
* Action-oriented with a focus on speed and results
* Strong computer science fundamentals
* Ability to thrive in a no-boundaries culture and make an impact on innovation


**Benefits Summary For US-Based Full-Time Direct Employment Positions**
**(The Recruiter will provide benefit details for non-US-based roles)**
 SambaNova offers a competitive total rewards package, including the base salary, plus equity and benefits. We cover 95% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, and 77% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution. We also offer Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life, and AD&D insurance plans in addition to Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options like Health Care, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care. Our library of well-being benefits available to you and your dependents includes a full subscription to Headspace, Gympass+ membership with access to physical gyms, One Medical membership, counseling services with an Employee Assistance Program, and much more.
   

  

**Submission Guidelines**
 Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at SambaNova Systems, you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified.
   

  

*If you are a new, recent (within the last two years), or upcoming college graduate and are interested in opportunities with SambaNova Systems, please apply through our university job listings.*
**EEO Policy**
 SambaNova Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard basis of age (40 and over), color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin/ancestry, race, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding), sexual orientation, and any other applicable status protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Android Developer – Video Streaming Player expert
description:
Android Developer – Video Streaming Player expert
 



  





 We’re seeking an Android Developer with strong experience in video streaming and player development to join our expert team at Eyevinn Technology. You’ll work on exciting projects that enhance the video experience for our clients
 



  





 What You’ll Do:
 



 - Develop and optimize Android video player applications
 



 - Work on cross-platform solutions with React Native
 



 - Collaborate on projects ranging from technical implementation to business advisory, focusing on video streaming solutions.
 



 - Contribute to open-source projects.
 



  





 Requirements:
 



 - 5+ years of software development experience, with 3+ years in video streaming player development.
 



 - Proficient in Android development using Java/Kotlin and ExoPlayer.
 



 - Experience with React Native.
 



 - Familiarity with technologies such as HLS, MPEG-DASH, and DRM.
 



  





 Meriting Skills:
