* Engage with existing and potential customers, understanding their needs and challenges, and align solutions accordingly.
* Support revenue growth through successful product positioning and competitive differentiation.
* Team Management and Development:
* Lead and inspire a diverse team in functions including Products & Strategy, Technology & Development, Consulting, and Sales & Marketing.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, creativity, and accountability.
* Support career development and employee engagement initiatives to attract and retain top talent.


**Qualifications:**
* Strong international experience in software product development.
* The international setup of the unit will be much larger than current situation with approximately 400 employees in 6 countries. Due to our ambitions plans with expansion, we would need a person with international leadership skills in different cultures.
* Higher education within Information Technology or a related field.
* Extensive leadership experience within the software industry, preferably in a product-centric unit.
* It would be beneficial with understanding of case and document management systems, process automation, and compliance in the Nordic and DACH region in Europe.
* Demonstrated experience in driving business transformation towards a SaaS business model.
* Knowledge of the potential of technology trends such as AI to enhance customers' business and internal processes in the organization.
* Excellent strategic thinking, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proven track record in driving product innovation and revenue growth.


**Other Comments:**
 The position can be located anywhere, with international travel required. Join us at Tietoevry and be part of a dynamic team that is revolutionizing the public sector through digital solutions. With our market-leading Public 360° software suite, you will have the opportunity to drive innovation, contribute to business transformation, and make a real impact on societies worldwide.
   

  

 For more information, please contact Search Consultant, Per Christian Blom, phone 0047 97720235, email: perchristian.blom@tietoevry.com
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Fastighetsskötare
description:
*Var 660:e person som går till arbetet i Sverige är en ISS-medarbetare och det är vi stolta över. Vi är ett av Sveriges och Nordens största tjänsteföretag samt har över 450 000 medarbetare världen över. Det är våra medarbetare som är kärnan i vår verksamhet och förutsättningen för att kunna leva upp till vårt syfte, Connecting people and places to make the world work better. På ISS Facility Services skapar vi platser och miljöer som bidrar till bättre prestationer och en enklare, mer effektiv och trivsam tillvaro - levererade med omtanke och hög kvalitet av engagerade medarbetare. Vill du också bli en del i vår globala organisation där ditt jobb verkligen gör skillnad?*
 ISS har inlett ett nytt spännande uppdrag vid ett av de största akutsjukhusen i Sverige. Är du Fastighetsskötare och nyfiken på att arbeta i en skarp, komplex driftmiljö med ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag? Sök då denna tjänst hos oss!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Fastighetsskötare kommer du i första hand att arbeta med tillsyn, skötsel och felavhjälpande arbeten på fastigheterna och dess tekniska installationer. Du kommer också att vara behjälplig vid driftstörningar och göra egna analyser och bedömningar i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

 Du har din bas vid Danderyds sjukhus. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, med en inledande provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Du kommer att arbeta nära kompetenta medarbetare som du får stort utbyte av, då vi värnar om att hjälpa och utveckla varandra. ISS storlek och breda tjänsteutbud bidrar till att det finns goda utvecklingsmöjligheter såväl nationellt som globalt. Vårt fokus ligger i att ta hand om och utveckla våra medarbetare, för vi tror på att ”People make places”. ISS erbjuder bland annat utbildningar och talangprogram – allt för att du ska engageras och utvecklas på jobbet.
   

  

 Vi värderar mångfald och inkludering högt. Hos ISS är alla människor lika mycket värda och har samma rättigheter och möjligheter. Våra medarbetare speglar samhällets mångfald, vilket både är en konkurrensfördel och en tillgång i vårt långsiktiga hållbara arbete. Vår inkluderande företagskultur stärker våra medarbetare, gör oss mer kreativa och produktiva samt skapar en attraktivare arbetsplats.
   

  

 ISS värderingar, som är fundamentala i hur vi arbetar, är kvalitet, ansvar, ärlighet, entreprenörskap och gemenskap. Därför är det viktigt att du känner att du står för ett arbetssätt och ett förhållningssätt som är i enlighet med dessa.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som har relevant utbildning för rollen eller likvärdig erfarenhet samt kunskaper att kunna utföra de arbetsuppgifter som åligger rollen som Fastighetsskötare och grundläggande brandskyddskunskaper.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid din personlighet och ser gärna att du själv skulle beskriva dig som en lagspelare som också trivs med att fatta beslut självständigt. Att du är kommunikativ, noggrann, har god samarbetsvilja och är serviceinriktad. Det är en förutsättning att du är teknisk och har goda IT-kunskaper, framför allt i Office-paketet, fastighetssystem, uppföljningssystem och dylikt. Tjänsten ställer även krav på att du har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift. B-körkort är ett krav.
   

  

**Om kunden** 
 Då sjukhuset driver säkerhetskänslig verksamhet kommer säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll genomföras före anställning.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi hoppas att vi väckt ditt intresse! Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, dock senast 30 november. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att ske löpande och vara något förlängd pga. säkerhetsprövningar. I din ansökan bifogar du CV, vi önskar ej personliga brev. Pga. GDPR kan vi ej ta emot ansökningar via mail.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat vilket innebär att processen innehåller intervjuer och referenstagningar. Vid eventuella frågor om processen, kontakta arbetsledare Tim Jälminger på tim.jalminger@se.issworld.com eller 0704583416.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: TDD/ESG Specialist
description:
**About JLL**
 We are JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Our mission is to help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
   

  

 If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!
   

  

**We are looking for a TDD/ESG Specialist to strengthen our Swedish Building Consultancy & ESG team**
**About Project And Development Services (PDS)**
 JLL is a world class real estate development partner for our investor and corporate clients. Our services affect how millions of people live, work, and play every day. It is our responsibility to nurture the impact we can have on all projects and bring value into every detail. From technical due diligence to sustainability and development advisory, from project and cost management for fit-out projects to refurbishments and major base-build schemes, our services span every dimension across all asset types, sectors and regions.
   

  

 JLL’s PDS team comprises 8,900 project managers, engineers, designers and architects across 50 countries and is actively managing 36,900+ projects yearly. Join the PDS team to expect more and achieve more. There’s room for you to design and build your career within the PDS community and the wider JLL ecosystem.
   

  

 In Sweden, PDS comprises of project managers within the Building Consultancy, Corporate Project Management, Development Advisory and Construction Management teams. The Building Consultancy team has a major focus on assisting clients in undertaking Technical & Environmental Due Diligence (TEDD) assessments prior to acquisition or disposal of assets. In addition, our team undertake ESG assessments as part of transactions or as part of improvement strategies post-acquisition to improve assets from a sustainability and value perspective.
   

  

 JLLs Building Consultancy team want to expand further to meet increased demands from clients in helping with TEDD assessments and especially ESG related queries. We assist both global and local Nordic clients in transaction advisory and asset improvement strategies concerning ESG and sustainability related items. ESG and sustainability services include but are not limited to EPC uplift assessments, energy saving and improvement calculations, building certifications, Net-Zero carbon assessments including CRREM analysis as well as climate risk assessments and EU Taxonomy compliance.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Within the Building Consultancy department, you will provide technical advisory services for and on behalf of property companies/funds, investors and public players. Projects can vary between small scale single properties to large portfolios throughout EMEA. We are actively seeking a TDD/ESG specialist who wants to become an integral part of our diverse and talented Building Consultancy team. We summarise below the main responsibilities:
   

  

* Meaningful Impact: As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will play a critical role in helping clients make sound investment decisions by assessing the condition of the building and technical installations, providing CAPEX cost estimates, and give strategic advice to help clients in determining go/no-go decisions before acquisition/disposal.
* Key Skills: You are proficient in preparing technical reports and cost estimates such as condition surveys, maintenance plans and due diligence assessments. You actively seek new client contacts and leads and business opportunities. Your key skills in technical report writing and active client engagement will be put into action daily as you create new business opportunities, undertake assessments, and provide valuable insights to clients in a timely manner.
* Focus on ESG and Sustainability: Familiarity with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Ideally, you have worked with some of these systems or have experience in conducting assessments and identifying improvements. As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will be involved in energy-saving assessments (EPC improvement) and reducing the carbon impact of assets (via CRREM/LCA assessments).
* Wider Sustainability Services: You will actively collaborate with team members assisting with environmental desktop assessments (EDD), climate risk assessments, Life Cycle Assessments (LCA), EU Taxonomy and CSRD.


**Experience And Knowledge**
* Minimum five years’ experience working in property branch including some experience with TEDD projects, sustainable development, maintenance planning, facilities management and/or project management.
* Demonstrate a keen interest in identifying opportunities for improvements relating to cost and energy savings
* Exhibit fluent proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish.
* Have experience with or a strong interest in working with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Familiarity with EPC systems including improvement assessments and recommendations.


**Personal qualities**
 You should have the ability to quickly form an overall picture of complex issues and are not afraid to make decisions. As a person, you describe yourself as prestige less and easy to work with. For the role, it is important that you are someone who can build and maintain good relationships with colleagues and clients while taking great pride in doing a good job, at all levels. Furthermore, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have the ability to handle the demands of managing multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines.
* Appreciate and thrive in an international corporate environment, leveraging cultural diversity and global perspectives. Are business driven with a holistic approach
* Are outgoing and a good networker and relationship builder. See opportunities, enjoys challenges and has a positive attitude. Have energy, perseverance, and an inner drive. Have a high level of commitment, initiative, and flexibility


**Teamworking and active collaboration within JLL;**
* You enjoy working within teams throughout Europe and with different business lines within JLL (Capital Markets, Valuation, Leasing, Debt&Financing) to create value for clients and help them in determining strategy and targets regarding ESG matters and investment decisions
* Collaborate with colleagues to identify and secure new project opportunities, effectively presenting and selling the company's services.
* Contribute to the continuous development of internal structures and processes, streamlining project workflows and enhancing overall efficiency.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Collaborative and Inclusive Team Environment: We foster a supportive and inclusive team environment where diverse perspectives are valued, and ideas are encouraged. Join our team and contribute to a culture of collaboration, mutual respect, and innovation.
   

  

 Travel and Networking Opportunities: This role offers the opportunity to work on projects across the Nordics, allowing you to broaden your professional horizons and establish valuable connections within the industry. You will have the possibility to expand your network of clients and contacts, creating new opportunities and projects (within Nordics but also EMEA).
   

  

 Professional Development: We offer training programs to ensure that our team members are up to date with the latest industry standards (including building certification training plus JLL ESG training). You will have the opportunity to enhance your knowledge and skills to further advance your career.
   

  

 You will be involved in growing our project management business. You will be involved in providing strategic advice to many of Sweden’s and some of the world’s largest property and asset management funds in relation to Due Diligence and sustainability (via energy improvements).
   

  

 You will work in an international and interdisciplinary work environment together with many competent and ambitious colleagues. JLL will strive to enable you to develop via introducing you team members throughout EMEA who work with similar fields to build collaboration and improve services for clients.
   

  

 You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
   

  

 Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition (including bonus system), wellbeing, benefits and pay.
   

  

 Apply today at jll.com/careers.
   

  

**JLL Corporate Solutions AB**
**Tom Lord**
**Head of Building Consultancy (TEDD GDD ESG)**
 Tom.lord@jll.com

title: Site Manager - Workshop
description:
Alfa Laval in Jordbro is looking for a
   

  

**Site Manager - Workshop**
*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.*
*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
**About The Job**
 We are looking for a dedicated Site Manager to lead our BU High-Speed Separators workshop in Jordbro and guide it into the future. In this role, you will manage day-to-day operations, ensuring smooth production, warehouse and packaging processes while taking responsibility for site safety, environmental compliance, and financial performance.
   

  

 You will be tasked with ensuring the factory has the right resources—machinery, personnel, and expertise—to achieve long-term sustainable business results. As the Site Manager, you will be accountable for the entire supply chain, overseeing everything from start to finish, and driving the factory’s overall performance and development.
   

  

 Your leadership will be essential in optimizing workflows, driving continuous improvement, and supporting internal and external customers. Additionally, you will lead ISO certifications, collaborate with HR, finance, and other teams, and oversee new product development with R&D.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include**
* Overseeing operations to ensure smooth production and packaging.
* Managing the workshop with a focus on safety, environmental compliance, and financial responsibility.
* Ensuring the factory has the necessary resources to achieve sustainable results.
* Taking end-to-end responsibility for the supply chain and factory development.
* Leading ISO certifications, customer audits and compliance with standards.
* Collaborating with HR, finance, and serving as the local contact for Alfa Laval internally and unions.
* Driving improvements in cost efficiency and production processes.
* Ensuring top-level support for internal and external customers.


**Who You Are**
 To succeed in this role, you thrive in dynamic environments where multiple tasks happen simultaneously. You are a team player who knows how to motivate your team to reach shared goals. You have a strong attention to detail and are comfortable leading in a fast-paced setting. With a focus on results, you are organized, customer-oriented, and always looking for ways to improve. Furthermore, we expect you to have:
   

  

* Leadership experience in managing and improving production departments, ideally in stainless-steel process system manufacturing.
* Experience in cost-saving strategies and improving both products and processes.
* Experience in production and machine investments.
* A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Production Engineering, Industrial Economics, or equivalent experience.
* Ability to read technical drawings such as layouts and flow diagrams.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English.
* Knowledge of TIG, orbital welding and ISO 3834-2, is considered meritorious as well as experience in manufacturing of equipment for the medical industry.


**What’s in it for you?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value for our customers. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success.
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Mats Berg, Supply Manager, Engineering & Supply, Business Unit HSS +46 72 161 5165
   

  

 Richa Sethi, Talent Acquisition Partner, richa.sethi@alfalaval.com
   

  

**For Union information, please contact**
 Kenneth Widerström, Ledarna, kenneth.widerstrom@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Anders Jansson, Unionen, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Francisco Garcia, Akademikerna, francisco.garcia@alfalaval.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application no later than
 **September 23rd, 2024** 
 , through our career page https://career.alfalaval.com/jobs/search
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to please submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.*

title: People Partner
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

 We are looking for a dynamic and experienced People Partner to join our People team. The ideal candidate will act as a trusted advisor, strategic partner, and advocate for employees and management at our offices in Stockholm and Uppsala. This role requires a blend of strong People expertise, business acumen, and exceptional interpersonal skills.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Act as a strategic partner to business leaders, understanding their goals and aligning People strategies to support them.
* Provide expert guidance on a range of HR functions, including talent management, employee relations, performance management, and organizational development.
* Drive employee engagement initiatives and promote a positive workplace culture.
* Lead and manage People projects that support the company’s strategic objectives.
* Coach and develop managers on effective leadership practices.
* Collaborate with local and global people team members to implement and improve people processes and programs.


**Qualifications**
* Experience in an HR generalist or HRBP role.
* Strong knowledge of People principles, practices, and Swedish employment laws.
* Proven ability to build strong relationships and influence at all levels of the organization.
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.


**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Flexible work arrangements.


**And one last thing...**
 If you’re excited about this role and meet most of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Södertörns tingsrätt söker en lagman
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Lagmannen är chef för tingsrätten och ansvarar för att verksamheten bedrivs rättssäkert och effektivt. En viktig uppgift för lagmannen är att leda genom andra chefer samt att samverka med andra myndighetschefer, inte minst inom Sveriges Domstolar. Lagmannen har också en viktig roll när det gäller att anpassa och utveckla domstolens verksamhet efter nya förutsättningar och att bidra till att domstolen är en attraktiv arbetsplats.
   

  

 Lagmannen ska vidare verka för att allmänheten har ett högt förtroende för domstolen och i detta ingår att lagmannen ska fortsätta utveckla domstolens kvalitetsarbete. Södertörns tingsrätt är en utvecklingsinriktad domstol som ligger i framkant inom verksamhetsutvecklingsfrågor. Vid tingsrätten pågår sedan flera år ett systematiskt och omfattande kvalitetsarbete där olika projekt för att förbättra verksamheten bedrivs. Tingsrätten arbetar aktivt med frågor som rör bemötande, mediekontakter, jämställhetsfrågor och klarspråk.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer m.m.
   

  

 En lagman ska svara mot mycket högt ställda krav på yrkesskicklighet såsom juridisk skicklighet, analysförmåga, förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift samt självständighet, omdöme och samarbetsförmåga. En lagman ska också ha en god administrativ förmåga samt intresse och förmåga att leda, fördela och utveckla domstolens arbete. Förmågan att engagera domstolens medarbetare är vidare av central betydelse. Målmedvetenhet och personlig drivkraft är viktiga egenskaper. Det är därtill viktigt att en lagman följer förändringar i omvärlden och inom organisationen samt har viljan och förmågan att finna lösningar och att förändra och utveckla domstolens verksamhet efter nya förutsättningar.
   

  

 Du som söker ska motsvara de krav som ställs i Domarnämndens kravprofil för ordinarie domare och den särskilda kravprofilen för chefer.
   

  

 Kravprofilerna hittar du via länken.
   

  

 Om Södertörns tingsrätt
   

  

 Södertörns tingsrätt är en av landets största tingsrätter med drygt 270 medarbetare. Domsagan omfattar fyra söderortskommuner i Stockholms län och de södra delarna av Stockholms stad. Tingsrätten handlägger drygt 20 000 brottmål, tvistemål och ärenden varje år. Målen som tingsrätten avgör är inte sällan omfattande och uppmärksammade. Domstolen uppfyller regeringens verksamhetsmål fullt ut.
   

  

 Tingsrätten är indelad i sex dömande avdelningar, en administrativ avdelning och en stab. Samtliga dömande avdelningar består utöver chefsrådmannen av en rådman som är chefsrådmannens ställföreträdare, fyra rådmän, två tingsfiskaler, en hanläggarchef, domstolshandläggare och notarier. Fem avdelningar har 28 medarbetare och en avdelning 34 medarbetare. Alla dömande avdelningar handlägger brottmål, tvistemål och familjemål. Konkursärenden handläggs endast på en avdelning. Den administrativa avdelningen leds av en administrativ direktör. På avdelningen finns också en chef för enheten för servicefrågor, en chef för enheten för säkerhetsfrågor samt en chef för enheten för registrering och arkiv. Avdelningen svarar bl.a. för ekonomi- och personaladministration, domstolservice och IT. Lagmannen har till stöd för sitt arbete som chef för tingsrätten en stab som ansvarar bl.a. för tingsrättens permanenta utvecklings- och kvalitetsarbete, utbildningsinsatser samt deltar i den dömande verksamheten. Lagmannen, chefsrådmännen, den administrativa direktören och stabschefen utgör tingsrättens ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 Övriga upplysningar
   

  

 Ordinarie domare anställs med fullmakt.
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och förutsätter därmed en godkänd säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Skriftlig ansökan med meritförteckning och övriga handlingar som den sökande önskar åberopa ska ges in till Domarnämnden. Ansökan bör ske på den blankett som tagits fram för ändamålet. Blanketten finns tillgänglig via länken.
   

  

 Domarnämnden kommer att hämta in skriftliga yttranden från de referenser som anges. Det är därför viktigt att deras adresser (gärna e-post) anges.

title: Sales & Business Development Manager
description:
**Vill du** 
**vara en del av ett världsledande IT-företag i stark tillväxt som du kan känna dig stolt över att representera? Är du redo för att direkt påverka företagets framgång och expansion på den svenska marknaden? Har du förståelse för gränssnittet mellan IT och business och ständigt ser möjligheter med digitalisering? Då kan du vara den Sales & Business Development Manager vi söker till vårt team i Stockholm.**
 Intility är känt för att leverera en komplett och industrialiserad IT-plattform som en tjänst, och är en katalysator för digitalisering. Intility har ansvar för 650 företags hela IT-miljöer, och har 50 000 användare på 2 500 platser i Skandinavien och resten av världen. Vi består av 600 kollegor med en genomsnittsålder på 28 år, som arbetar tillsammans för att underlätta digitaliseringen av morgondagens företag och utveckla värdefulla lösningar.
   

  

 I takt med vår starka tillväxt söker vi nu en Sales & Business Development Manager för att bli en grundpelare i vår svenska organisation och vårt kontor i Stockholm. Du är proaktiv, initiativtagande, självgående och redo att arbeta hårt för att fylla en central roll i företagets expansion på den svenska IT-marknaden. Den ideala kandidaten ser möjligheter i stället för hinder och drivs av att kontinuerligt sträva efter förbättring och innovation, tillsammans med ett team av skickliga kollegor.
   

  

**Viktiga Uppgifter Kommer Att Vara**
* Identifiera och bearbeta potentiella kunder, partners och affärsmöjligheter
* Bidra till, och efter hand leda, komplexa anbudsprocesser och förhandlingar i privata och offentliga upphandlingar
* Utveckling och implementering av marknadsföringsstrategier
* Vidareutveckling av Intilitys tjänster i linje med marknaden och trender
* Resor i samband med möten med potentiella och existerande kunder runt om i Sverige.


 Vår platta organisationsstruktur erbjuder dynamiska arbetsförhållanden och stora möjligheter till personligt initiativ och utveckling. Vi arbetar i en tvärvetenskaplig miljö där kunskapsdelning är en av våra nycklar till framgång, och där IT och teknologi är kärnan i verksamheten.
   

  

 Även om du blir en av de första kollegorna på kontoret i Stockholm, kommer du alltid jobba nära många av dina 600 kollegor på våra övriga kontor och förväntas regelbundet samarbeta och delta i utbyte av idéer och erfarenheter. Intility både underlättar för och önskar att du ibland besöker vårt huvudkontor i Oslo, för att främja både det sociala och professionella utbytet. Den första delen av din anställning sker i Oslo över en period på 3-6 månader, för att bekanta dig med kollegor och företaget, samt deltagande på Intility Academy. Intility står då för resekostnader och boende.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Masterexamen inom ekonomi, teknologi, projektledning, juridik eller liknande
* Gärna 1-5 års erfarenhet från privata och offentliga upphandlingar, projektledning, försäljning, konsultföretag eller liknande. Men även nyutexaminerade kan söka.
* Väldigt god skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska
* God förmåga att förstå och analysera komplex information
* Hög grad av nyfikenhet
* Intresse för skärningspunkten mellan IT och business
* Villighet att hjälpa och stötta dina kollegor
* God förmåga att organisera och planera
* Förmågan att få med dig andra för att lösa problem och utmaningar


  

  

**Hos oss:**
* Representerar du ett koncept som du är stolt över
* Får du kontinuerligt öka din kunskap genom Intility Academy
* Blir du, med stöttning från dina kollegor, kastad ut i utmanande arbetsuppgifter från dag ett
* Är du betydelsefull, eftersom din kunskap är avgörande för Intility
* Blir du en del av ett energiskt företag med många sociala evenemang
* Får du en rad sociala och personliga förmåner som hjälper dig att trivas på jobbet
* Får du en unik möjlighet att vara tidig in och bli en viktig del av Intilitys tillväxt och utveckling på den svenska IT-marknaden


 På Intility är vi angelägna om att alla anställda ska trivas på jobbet och tillsammans med sina kollegor. Vi erbjuder därför olika sociala och kompetensutvecklande arrangemang under hela året. Du får även tillgång på våra lägenheter på sommar- och vinter-resorterna med spa på Kragerø och Norefjell som kan besökas tillsammans med såväl kollegor, som familj och vänner.
   

  

 Uppstartsdatumet är flexibelt och vi tar gärna emot kandidater som antingen har möjlighet att starta redan nu eller senare.
   

  

 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vill arbeta på ett företag där du verkligen kan göra skillnad, ser vi fram emot din ansökan. Skicka in din ansökan, med CV, personligt brev och betyg från gymnasium och universitet/högskola.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökningar behandlas löpande.**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Intility er en komplett plattform-tjeneste som ivaretar et ende-til-ende driftsansvar for IT-miljøene til over 600 selskaper i Norge og resten av verden 🌍
   

  

 I Intility er vi opptatt av å skape et godt arbeidsmiljø med rom for personlig og faglig utvikling 📈 Vi har stort fokus på trivsel, og har dedikerte ressurser som passer på at du som ansatt trives både på jobb og i hverdagen. I tillegg gis du stor påvirkningskraft i et ungt, dynamisk og uhøytidelig miljø. Sammen bygger vi noe som er større enn summen av den enkelte! 👊

title: People, HR Director, Sweden
description:
📍 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Are you a resourceful leader ready to shape the future of People and Culture at Columbus in Sweden, driving impactful HR initiatives that elevate our employee experience and foster business growth?
   

  

 We are looking for a visionary and experienced People Director to lead the People and Culture strategy, and drive HR operations, talent management, and business partners in Columbus Sweden with 420 employees including the People team.
   

  

 Your key responsibility is to drive the implementation of Columbus’ people strategy, you will play an important role in shaping our local people agenda. In this role, you will report directly to the Global Chief People Officer (CPO) a part of the Swedish leadership team, and work closely with the Swedish Market Unit Executive.
   

  

**Core Responsibilities**
 You will be part of the Swedish leadership team, act as a strategic partner and advisor to the Market Unit Executive, providing HR guidance and support:
   

  

* Drive the People agenda, lead and develop your team, continue to improve and build our culture to ensure a positive employee experience based on Columbus values and leadership principles
* Ensure the HR Transformation & implementation of the people strategy, aligning local processes with global standards
* Oversee, continuously improve and support HR operations, talent management, and compensation & benefit processes
* Resolve and handle delicate matters in a local context, employee relations issues, ensuring compliance with local labor laws


 As part of the Global People Directors team, you will collaborate globally, participate, and drive global people projects including:
   

  

* Preparing and implementing a consolidated HR strategy across market units (covering Europe, the US, and India)
* Ensure our career path journey remains aligned with global standards
* Continue to drive HR digitalization and global HR operations
* Maintaining inclusive initiatives with a focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I), employee experience, and Employee Value Proposition (EVP)


 We want Columbus to be the go-to place for people passionate about being digital advisors for future transformations. To make this happen, you’ll help shape our culture and values at every step of the employee journey, supporting our team as they grow into trusted digital advisors for our clients.
   

  

**Your Background And Experience**
 The successful candidate has a Bachelor's or Master's degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related field combined with a minimum of 7+ years of global & Swedish HR leadership experience. This includes:
   

  

* Experience from a global matrix organization preferably within IT service & technology or consulting
* Solid, working knowledge of HR policies, procedures, and local legislation related to employment practices and general HR administration
* Broad experience in Compensation & Benefits, HR compliance & HR Services, Talent Management, HR Information Systems, and digitalization
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on using data to guide decisions
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


 To succeed in the role, you have excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust among several stakeholders and employees. You are also able to navigate different priorities, manage your agenda, and effectively plan, prioritize, and execute.
   

  

**Become a part of Columbus!**
 You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so submit your application today – it only takes a few seconds. Please submit your application before September 27, 2024.
   

  

 For further information you are welcome to contact Talent Acquisition Lead, Ann-Michelle Buus Trebbien on +45 29690640 or email mitr@columbusglobal.com
   

  

**About Columbus**
 Columbus is an IT consultancy firm with 1,800 employees worldwide. Our core strength lies in the development, implementation, and maintenance of digital business solutions. Our mission is to guide clients through their digital transformation, ensuring their businesses thrive for years to come. Over the past 30 years, more than 5,000 clients have chosen to work with us. Simply put, we’re doing well 🚀. If you ask us, the secret lies in our extensive range of technical solutions, deep industry knowledge, comprehensive technical expertise, and a strong understanding of our clients.
   

  

 Our employees are passionate about their work, and the company is characterised by a strong entrepreneurial spirit. This is thanks to the real opportunities available to influence both our own business and that of our clients. We’re expanding and would love to have you join us on this journey!
   

  

 Working at Columbus
   

  

 Take a look at our Instagram account to meet our colleagues and get a glimpse behind the scenes of life at Columbus.
   

  

**Entirely unfiltered** 
 we have collected reviews from current and previous colleagues. Click below to read more.

title: Senior D365 F&O Consultant | Stockholm | Hybrid
description:
Are you looking to take your expertise in Dynamics 365 F&O to the next level?
   

  

 Searching for a Senior D365 F&O Consultant to join an industry-leading team in Stockholm. Joining as a key member within the organisation, you will play a vital role in driving innovation and transforming the client's financial and operational systems through the power of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O.
   

  

 What You'll Do:
   

  

* Lead the design, configuration, and deployment of D365 F&O solutions tailored to business needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end implementations.
* Analyze business processes and recommend best practices to optimise D365 F&O functionality.
* Provide leadership and mentoring to junior consultants and project teams.
* Ensure projects are completed on time, within scope, and meet client expectations.


 What We're Looking For:
   

  

* Strong proficiency and experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations.
* Proven track record in leading large-scale D365 F&O implementations.
* Strong understanding of finance, supply chain, and operations processes.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on client success.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and in a collaborative team environment.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

* Work in Stockholm's thriving tech hub with a diverse and inclusive team.
* Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for career growth.
* Ongoing professional development through certifications.
* A supportive environment where your input and leadership matter.
* Company culture and human-centred values


 Apply or get in contact ASAP!
   

  

 e.lees@nigelfrank.com

title: HPE Financial Services Partner Sales Manager
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
**A day in the life of HPE Financial Services Partner Sales Manager:**
 Role measured on HPEFS Leasing Volume and margin contribution within identified strategic resellers, partner satisfaction and effective management of partner relationship.
   

  

* Act as HPEFS point of contact with Channel partner for all Financing queries - particularly with partner's key Sales, Marketing and Product management, same with the HPE and HP Partner Business channel team.
* Develop and implement program strategy which includes integration into HPE / HP and HPEFS sales segment with special attention to driving HPEFS business to the Mid-market and SMB customers. Documented in Joint Business Planning designed and agreed with both Partner Executives and related HPE/HP related owner
* Own the HPEFS pipeline / lead generation with assigned Partners
* Accountability to have HPEFS Sales resources executing in timely manner on Partner pipeline.
* Involved in Deal processing and forecasting activities jointly with The Partner Sales teams, and HPE/HP related sales resources
* Overall responsibility for day-to-day operations of the HPEFS channel reward programme, ensuring partner satisfaction across all elements of the business transaction lifecycle: Sales, Credit, Documentation/Funding, Partner Incentive.
* Develop and provide training to partner sales teams.
* Drive quarterly onsite review meetings to review previous quarter results and to determine next steps for success.
* Drive regular communication to partner regarding Promotion updates, Tool updates, new Program announcements, etc.
* Identify, propose and implement additional capabilities within the Channel Partner business model to create increased value add for the reseller in the selling and promoting of HPEFS services.
* Gather and Provide competitive intelligence to both Partners and HPEFS


**You are...**
* Experienced in creating and managing relationship with IT Partner community - 3 to 5 years’ experience in IT sales, preferably in IT financing.
* Experienced at building Business Development strategy with IT Partners
* Successful sales experience including multiple, diverse set of selling responsibilities (own and individual sales quota carrying)
* Viewed as trusted expert in given field by customer; is a mentor of selling strategy, including designing strategy
* University or Bachelor's degree preferred
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #spain, #sweden
   

  

 #financialservices
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Specialist
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Förbundsjurist
description:
Akavia är fackförbundet för ekonomer, jurister, samhällsvetare, IT-akademiker, personalvetare och kommunikatörer. Vi samlar 140 000 medlemmar vilket gör oss till det tredje största förbundet inom Saco. Namnet Akavia betyder den akademiska vägen och bygger på löftet att varje medlem ska få utväxling på sin akademiska utbildning genom hela arbetslivet. Akavia är partipolitiskt obundet och arbetar för ett utvecklande och hållbart yrkesliv med högt välbefinnande. Vi har drygt 130 medarbetare med kontor i Malmö, Göteborg och Stockholm.
 



 Nu söker vi en förbundsjurist till vår juridiska enhet, som är en del av Akavias förhandlingsavdelning.
 



  





 Om rollen
 



 Som förbundsjurist hos oss arbetar du brett i legala frågor som rör förbundet och våra medlemmar. Du spelar en nyckelroll i att ge medlemmarna kvalificerat juridiskt stöd, rådgivning och rättshjälp i domstol. Du bidrar också aktivt till att påverka lagstiftningen och att utveckla våra kollektivavtal för att stärka medlemmarnas profession och arbetsvillkor. Du har även en viktig roll i att stödja och utveckla förbundets verksamhet.
 



 Du arbetar tillsammans med fyra andra förbundsjurister i ett tryggt team där vi vågar testa nya idéer, växa och lyckas. Vi ser långsiktigt på din utveckling och vill att du ska trivas, utvecklas och hjälpa oss att driva Akavia framåt. I rollen rapporterar du till chefsjuristen.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar att:
 


* Proaktivt utveckla och erbjuda kvalificerad juridisk vägledning och stöd till medlemmarna och verksamheten
* Företräda medlemmar och förbundet i domstol
* Bevaka och påverka rättsutvecklingen
* Hålla utbildningar internt och externt
* Göra rättsutredningar och medverka i arbetsgrupper
* Upprätta, förhandla och granska förbundets avtal
* Stödja och delta i arbetet med styrdokument, rutiner och processer


- 


 Vi söker dig som har
 


* Juristexamen med minst fem års erfarenhet av kvalificerat juridiskt arbete
* Erfarenhet av att självständigt driva tvister i domstol
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom arbetsrätt



  





 Det är meriterande om du har
 


* Notariemeritering
* Goda kunskaper inom affärsjuridik, dataskydd, socialförsäkringsrätt, skadeståndsrätt, arbetsmiljörätt eller diskrimineringsrätt



  





 Dina egenskaper
 



 För att lyckas och trivas i denna roll behöver du vara en lagspelare som är både handlingskraftig och lösningsorienterad. Med ditt prestigelösa förhållningssätt, ditt mod att utmana för verksamhetens bästa och ditt engagemang för medlemmarnas utveckling, bidrar du till att Akavia når sina mål.
 



 Som person är du noggrann, analytisk och strukturerad. Du är ansvarstagande, har en utmärkt förmåga att kommunicera både muntligt och skriftligt samt är mycket skicklig på att etablera goda relationer, både internt och externt. Du är också välgrundad i din juridiska kompetens och har förmågan att förmedla den på ett målgruppsanpassat och förtroendeskapande sätt.
 



  





 Akavia – Inte som andra förbund
 



 Vår grunduppfattning är att akademisk utbildning ska löna sig. Vi tror på individens förmåga att ta eget ansvar för sin professionella utveckling, anställningsbarhet och konkurrenskraft. Våra medlemmar utgör tillsammans en stark part på arbetsmarknaden i ett förbund med professionsfokus och ambitionen att utveckla moderna kollektivavtal.
 



 Akavia vill vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare som bidrar till ett hållbart arbetsliv. Vi tillämpar hybridarbete med möjlighet att delvis arbeta utanför kontoret. Vi har ett fördelaktigt kollektivavtal med flexibla förmåner och ett modernt kontor på Nybrogatan i Stockholm.
 



  





 Är du rätt person för oss?
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan med CV och personligt brev så snart som möjligt och senast den 30 september 2024.
 



  





 Vi samarbetar i den här rekryteringen med Just Right AB. Vid frågor, välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Catarina Isaksson, tfn 072- 205 45 48, e-post: catarina.isaksson@justright.se
 



  





 Facklig kontaktperson för frågor om tjänsten är Victor Mossberg, telefon 010-303 76 34, victor.mossberg@akavia.se

title: Senior Marketing Compliance Consultant for our in-house team
description:
*PharmaRelations is the Nordic market leader within talent services for the life science industry. We specialize in partnering with some of the top and most innovative organizations exclusively in the Life Science sector across our region. We add value to our clients and candidates with our consultancy services, outsourcing solutions and recruitment of specialists and leaders.* 




  





*We are a Nordic organization with over 260 colleagues and with offices in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. Our head quarters is located in Solna, Sweden.* 




  





 Are you an accomplished professional with extensive experience in marketing compliance and an exceptional ability to drive sales initiatives? PharmaRelations is expanding its team and is actively seeking a highly experienced
 **Senior Marketing Compliance Consultant** 
 to join our dynamic in-house team in Sweden. This is your opportunity to shape the future of compliance services and contribute significantly to our consultancy's growth.
 



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 We are looking for someone with a strong background in marketing compliance, ideally a mix of marketing compliance and regulatory affairs experience. You thrive in a flexible, service-oriented, and collaborative environment, enjoying the dynamic nature of consulting work. A natural problem solver, you excel in helping clients find effective ways to communicate. What sets you apart is not just your compliance expertise but also your enthusiasm for sales and your vision for expanding a compliance consultancy, including developing service offerings and implementing visibility strategies.
 



  





 To be an ideal fit for this position, you should meet the following qualifications:
 


* Minimum 5-7 years of experience in marketing compliance, gained from the pharmaceutical industry
* Certification in marketing compliance (e.g., IMA certificate from courses via Läkemedelsakademien).
* Proficiency in Swedish and English.
* If you are familiar with ethical frameworks in other Nordic countries it’s meritorious.



  





 To thrive at PharmaRelations and with our clients, we believe that you are a non-prestigious person who is happy to contribute to a good atmosphere in the workplace. Communication and collaboration with customers and colleagues come naturally to you, and you enjoy working both independently and in teams.
 



  





**Why?** 




 Joining PharmaRelations means being part of a dynamic and forward-thinking community who are passionate about their work. Our success-driven atmosphere is designed to foster innovation, creativity, and a sense of accomplishment.
 



  





 You will get the chance to develop your skills, and to work with a team of highly intelligent, innovative, and passionate experts across the Nordics. PharmaRelations offer a place where there is room for you to excel, be valued and make a difference. Not just to us, but ultimately indirectly to the patients’ lives we help improve and save every day by servicing the Life Science Industry.
 



  





 At PharmaRelations we also aim to become the best place to work within Nordic Life Science Industry. We follow
 *Great Place to Work’* 
 s model, and our definition of “the best” is to get the highest results among all Nordic Life Science companies in the GPTW model. It is a challenging goal, but we strive to always continue to challenge ourselves to continuously improve and become a better and better employer for each year. What does the best place to work mean to you?
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 For further information please don’t hesitate to reach out to Anna-Karin Sverdrup, Head of Regulatory Affairs Sweden, anna-karin.sverdrup@pharmarelations.se.
 



  





 Applications will be handled continuously. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





*Due to GDPR, we cannot receive any CVs via e-mail.*

title: Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Legal team** 





 The Legal team at Trustly is the guardian of Trustly’s regulatory licenses in Sweden, France and the UK, consisting of experts in regulations on payment services, privacy & data protection and commercial law. Currently a team of ten and growing, based in Stockholm, Paris and London.
 








**About the role** 





 As a Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory, you are part of a dynamic legal team providing expertise to the product & tech and commercial teams in all things involving payment services regulation and commercial contracts. You are a professional in legal risk assessment, keeping presence of mind in complex and urgent situations, and giving knowledgeable recommendations to decision-makers across the whole organization. The position is based in Stockholm.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Safeguard the regulatory licenses of Trustly, including manage the relationships with the regulators with care and diligence
* Interpret payment services regulation, including translating this into meaningful and useful information for the product & tech team when it is designing innovative and human-centric payment products
* At times, support the commercial team in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts
* Support the organization in solution-oriented handling of various legal issues



  




**Who you are** 
* Holds a Master of Laws Degree
* 4-6 years of relevant experience from a payment services company, a commercial law firm, and/or supervisory authority is preferred (knowledge in PSD2 and future regulations on payment initiation services is a plus)
* Passionate about the payment industry
* Excellent English and Swedish language skills
* Driven and curious with a positive can-do attitude
* Terrific team player






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Senior Environmental Specialist
description:
**Position:** 
 Senior Environmental Specialist, Nordics
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 Nico Fioravanti, Quality & Environmental Manager, KONE Nordics
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Helsinki
   

  

**About Us**
 KONEs mission is to improve the flow of urban life. KONE is one of the world's leading companies in the elevator and escalator industry. We supply elevators, escalators, gates, and automatic doors, as well as maintenance and modernization solutions for the entire life cycle of buildings. We help people move safely and comfortably in taller, smarter buildings. We call it
 *People Flow.* 
 In 2022, KONE had annual sales of EUR 10.9 billion, and at the end of the year over 60,000 employees. KONE class B shares are listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki Ltd. in Finland.
   

  

**The Position**
 The successful candidate will report to the Quality and Environment Manager for KONE Nordics and will work proactively with KONE's environmental awareness and efforts. As an Environmental (and Sustainability) Specialist, you will be responsible for achieving the environmental requirements set for the organization, especially customer requirements. Your work will cover all 8 countries included in the KONE Nordics Frontline: Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Iceland and the Baltic States. You will collect and analyze data, drive continuous improvement of processes, procedures and guidelines and ensure that KONE complies with local environmental requirements and laws. You will actively build and spread environmental awareness within the organization by organizing training and sharing best business practices. You will lead the development, implementation and follow-up of our processes, methods and systems to measure and analyze environmental performance indicators.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Review and execute compliance requirements related to solutions, operations & customer projects
* Deliver on-time customer requirement data collection for green building projects in tendering and delivery
* Follow up business requirements continuously, especially green building market trends and related local certification schemes, and develop unit business operations accordingly
* Develop unit low-carbon operations in line with business needs
* Gather data to analyze trends and for quarterly environmental reporting
* Participate in internal and external audits
* Prioritize environmental performance improvement based on data analysis
* Use continuous improvement methodologies to investigate non-conformances and determine root cause, identify corrective actions, and drive actions to closure
* Participate in creating environmental training for unit employees


**Requirements:**
* You have a suitable university degree in environmental science or equivalent.
* At least 5 years of experience within environmental development and management
* You are familiar with environmental legislation and the ISO 14001 standard.
* Background in change management and a proven track of change management skills
* A collaborative mindset, with a high sense of responsibility, accountability, and a hands-on approach to tasks
* You are passionate about environment-related issues
* You work proactively to understand and improve the current practices in KONE’s Environmental management
* Excellent communication, training and organizational skills.
* You cultivate an understanding and actively caring culture for environmental questions. Act as a role model.
* Ability to work effectively within a matrix organization and build strong networks
* You have good command of English language written and spoken and one other Nordic language.
* Solid IT skills, preferably experience of Qlik, Excel, Power BI and Powerpoint.
* Full professional proficiency in English and one other Nordic language


***What do we offer?***
 We offer interesting and challenging work where environment-related issues always are a strong part of our operations, but we still have room for improvement. In our team, we respect the important values of our company: caring, customer, cooperation, and courage. We also offer the opportunity to learn more, develop with work and enjoy being part of a good team. We have great career progression opportunities within a global organization.
   

  

 At KONE, you are offered the opportunity to join a market-leading company. KONE is leading the way in the industry and is featured on Forbes' list of the most innovative companies in the world. KONE is a global company with a flat organization characterized by flexibility and openness. You are offered a fun and developing role that is characterized by freedom with responsibility and you get the opportunity to plan your own days. KONE has collective bargaining agreements, wellness allowances and other benefits, all gathered in one benefits portal.
   

  

***Applying***
 Are you what we are looking for? Please submit your application and CV as soon as possible but no later than 26.09.2024. Applications will be processed on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please do not hesitate to contact Quality & Environment Manager, Nordics & Baltics at nico.fioravanti@kone.com or if you have questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Talent Acquisition Specialist Sara Kinell sara.kinell@kone.com
   

  

*At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.*
 Read more on
 ***www.kone.com/careers***

title: Investor Relations Specialist
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**About Us**
 Mentimeter is a rapidly growing Swedish SaaS company dedicated to transforming meetings, presentations, and learning experiences through interactive and engaging tools. With a global user base and a commitment to innovation, we aim to make every voice heard and every idea shared. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Investor Relations Specialist to join our team in Stockholm.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As an Investor Relations Specialist at Mentimeter, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and communicating our investment story. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with current and potential investors, creating compelling IR materials, and ensuring compliance with financial reporting standards. Your work will directly impact our ability to attract and retain investors, contributing to the long-term success and growth of Mentimeter.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Investment Thesis Development: Articulate Mentimeter’s value proposition, business model, and market opportunities to current and potential investors. Develop a compelling narrative that highlights our competitive advantages and rationale for being a long term owner.
* Relationship Building: Engage with existing shareholders to keep them informed about company developments and performance. Identify and establish relationships with potential future investors (financial and strategic), analysts, and other key stakeholders.
* IR Material Creation: Develop and maintain investor presentation decks, fact sheets, Q&A documents, and other materials used in investor communications. Work closely with the finance, legal, and communications teams to ensure consistency and accuracy of information shared with investors.
* Reporting: Lead the preparation of Quarterly and Annual Reports (including CSRD and Corporate Governance reporting), including the creation of content that effectively tells our story. Ensure compliance with all Nasdaq regulations and other relevant financial reporting requirements.
* Investor Meetings: Plan and execute investor meetings, coordinating logistics and ensuring seamless communication. Together with CEO and CFO, represent Mentimeter in presentations to investors and analysts.
* Shareholder Meetings: Plan and coordinate annual shareholder meetings, including preparation of materials and logistics. Ensure shareholders have a platform to voice their opinions and concerns.
* Ongoing Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for investor inquiries, ensuring timely and transparent communication. Distribute quarterly earnings reports, press releases, and other key information to the investment community.
* Compliance & Governance: Manage the company’s disclosure policy and ensure adherence to fair disclosure regulations. Monitor market trends, investor sentiment, and share price movements, providing regular updates to the executive team.
* Crisis Management: Develop strategies for managing investor relations during challenging times (such as unexpected financial performance issues, regulatory investigations or other significant events) ensuring trust and confidence among investors.
* Secondary market: As long as the company operates in a private environment - Liaise with advisors to coordinate and make sure all legal compliance is in place when shareholders sell and buy shares. Handle communication to the shareholders in cases of other shareholders selling shares. Communicate to CEO and Chair of Board when movement in the shareholder book happens.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or a related field.
* 8+ years of experience in investor relations, equity research, financial communications, or a related role, preferably within the technology or SaaS sectors.
* Strong understanding of financial markets, investor expectations, and reporting requirements.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively.
* Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with investors, analysts as well as strategics.
* International diverse experience of all the above is highly desirable
* Experience with Nasdaq Stockholm regulations and financial reporting is highly desirable.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


**Why Mentimeter?**
* Join a fast-growing, innovative company with a mission to make meetings and presentations more interactive and engaging.
* Be part of a collaborative and diverse team that values creativity, transparency, and continuous learning.
* Opportunity to make a significant impact on the company’s growth and investor relations strategy.


**Application**
 If you are passionate about investor relations and are excited by the opportunity to help shape the future of a leading SaaS company, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Please submit your resume and a cover letter in English, detailing your experience and why you are the perfect fit for this role.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Introduction interview - Meet TA representative for an introduction interview
* Business Case - Conduct a business case showcasing your skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the hiring team in an in-depth onsite interview
* Culture interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: BATTERY PRODUCTION - Gruppchef inom logistik
description:
Var med på resan att bygga upp nya batteriproduktionen på Scania! Vi förser våra lastbilar & bussar med batterier och högspänningskablage för en elektrifierad framtid!
   

  

 Vi inom ME har befintliga produktionsanläggningar by228, by220 och i byggnad S26 där vi tillverkar moduler, batterier och högspänningskablage i olika stadier av produktutvecklingsprocessen.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Är du en ledare med passion för ständiga förbättringar och som vill göra skillnad/ bidra till en värld med mer hållbara transportlösningar? Då kan rollen som gruppchef på Scanias nya Batterifabrik vara något för dig!
   

  

 Som gruppchef bidrar du i det operativa och strategiska arbetet och kommer bli en del av ledningsgruppen för Materialhantering. Du spelar en viktig roll i att leda ditt team och jobba tillsammans med dina medarbetare för att uppnå önskat utfall i leveransen och Scanias prioriteringar. I din roll kommer du att leda ett team med materialhanterare bestående av cirka 15 fantastiska individer.
   

  

 Du formulerar och följer upp mål, driver effektiviserings- och förbättringsarbete, arbetar med uppföljningar och coachar dina medarbetare i att nå uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Du bidrar till att ständigt förbättra verksamheten och driva utvecklingen framåt utifrån LEAN och Scanias produktionssystem.
   

  

 Arbetet är dynamiskt och ställer höga krav på förändringsledning och att kunna hantera oförutsägbara situationer.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du är en nyfiken och ödmjuk person som gillar att hitta lösningar till små och stora problem tillsammans med ditt team.
   

  

 Oavsett om du har en akademisk bakgrund inom produktion/logistik är din passion för hållbarhet, förbättringar och människor det som verkligen utmärker dig. Som ledare har du goda kommunikationsförmågor, förmågan att inspirera samt motivera andra och det är av största vikt att du främjar en inkluderande och stärkande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Vi värdesätter mångfald högt i vårt team och vi uppmuntrar sökande av alla kön, åldrar och bakgrunder.
* Tidigare ledarerfarenhet inom produktion eller logistik är meriterande.
* Kunskap om Scanias produktionssystem och arbetsmetoder är meriterande.
* Du behöver kunna svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift, då det är avgörande för effektiv kommunikation inom vårt globala team.


**Vilka är vi?**
 Vårt logistikteam på Batteriproduktionen, ME, innefattar olika funktioner så som produktionsplanering, materialplanering, materialhantering, logistikutveckling, IT samt logistikteknik. Ditt ansvar kommer ligga inom materialhantering.
   

  

 Vårt syfte inom logistik är att skapa ett smidigt flöde av inkommande material och utgående produkter från externa leverantörer till interna kunder.
   

  

 Vi välkomnar alla och omfamnar en kultur av inkludering där varje röst är värdefull och respekterad. Mångfald, inkludering och teamwork är vår styrka.
   

  

 Möjligheterna på Scania är oändliga, vilket ger dig möjlighet att följa dina karriärambitioner och samtidigt göra en meningsfull inverkan på utformningen av framtidens transport.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och driva positiv förändring och forma framtidens hållbara transporter? Ansök här!
   

  

**Mer information**
 Vill du veta mer om denna roll kontakta gärna mig, Verkstadschef Erika Magnusson Kyrk, erika.magnusson.kyrk@scania.com
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Din ansökan ska innehålla personligt brev, CV och relevanta intyg. Ansök via hemsidan Reflex/Jobbsök snarast möjligt dock senast den 2024-10-02. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande under ansökningsperioden. En bakgrundskontroll kan komma att genomföras för denna tjänst.

title: IT Operator (Modern Workplace Support Operator)
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.
   

  

 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


**Job Description**
*Including, but not limited to the following* 
 activities:
   

  

* Responsible for end user support regarding Microsoft 365
* Responsible for end user support for Conference system and administrate the conference system back-end
* Coordinate the incoming incidents and catalog tasks for Digital Workplace, ensuring no incidents get left behind
* Add information to the Modern Workplace Learning site and ServiceNow Knowledgebase as part of the Digital Workplace team
* Collaborate with Global ServiceDesk around Digital Workplace issues and ensure a high service level to our end users
* Notice trends and report reoccurring problems
* Be part of the Digital Workplace Team, developing the workplace of the future at Sobi
* Stay up to date with end-user related changes in Microsoft 365
* Proactively monitor service health related issues in Microsoft 365 Admin Portal


**Qualifications**
* Experience in working with the Microsoft 365 platform, focusing on collaboration and Office apps, from both an end user and support perspective.
* Experience in leading training sessions for end-users and peers
* Experienced within remote support
* Knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating system environment
* Excellent documentation skills
* Excellent communication skills in English


**Desired**
* Basic knowledge of the ITIL framework is desired.
* Prior knowledge of working in a Microsoft 365 environment
* Customer oriented with a drive to find the optimal solutions for stakeholders and users
* Analytical, Structured, and self-motivated with ability to work on multiple tasks
* A strong team player, with the ability to work effectively in a team and interact with people of different cultural, seniority and functional backgrounds.


**Additional Information**
 All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
